intro: Eryngium jepsonii var. parishii, commonly known as the Parish's thistle, is a flowering plant native to California, specifically found in the Sierra Nevada foothills. It is a perennial herb with spiny, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has gray-green, hairy leaves that are typically alternate and have a distinctive, thistle-like appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. This variety is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads.
